DataElement.preferredName: Specimen Submission Question Communication Contact Source
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the source of the communication contact for specimen submission questions.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis._The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something._A sentence of inquiry that asks for a reply; a request for information (e.g., a formal request to a database or search engine)._A channel for communication between groups.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.
The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something.

Property.preferredDefinition: A sentence of inquiry that asks for a reply; a request for information (e.g., a formal request to a database or search engine).:A channel for communication between groups.

Concepts.definition: A sentence of inquiry that asks for a reply; a request for information (e.g., a formal request to a database or search engine).
A channel for communication between groups.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: contact information for communications over distance, including telephone and fax numbers, e-mail, and web addresses.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Where something is available or from where it originates.

PermissibleValues.value: Pathology Institution where the pathology specimens are held

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination.: An established society, corporation, foundation or other organization founded and united for a specific purpose, e.g. for health-related research; also used to refer to a building or buildings occupied or used by such organization.

Concepts.definition: The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination.

An established society, corporation, foundation or other organization founded and united for a specific purpose, e.g. for health-related research; also used to refer to a building or buildings occupied or used by such organization.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A person who is employed by a study sponsor or by a contract research organization (CRO), operates independently from the clinical study site and functions as a monitor, and/or auditor, and/or a project director within a particular trial or institution.

Concepts.definition: A person who is employed by a study sponsor or by a contract research organization (CRO), operates independently from the clinical study site and functions as a monitor, and/or auditor, and/or a project director within a particular trial or institution.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: contact information for communications over distance, including telephone and fax numbers, e-mail, and web addresses.

Concepts.definition: Where something is available or from where it originates.

ReferenceDocuments.description: Whom do you wish us to contact for questions relating to pathology specimen submissions?
